main_text:
Philosophy
2. Philosophy

Royce’s early studies in Germany and at the Johns Hopkins
University concentrated on the development of post-Kantian idealism.
His philosophical work as a whole may be regarded as a committed
idealist’s effort to understand the place of finite individuals
in an infinite universe, a theme that Royce captured most succinctly
in his Gifford Lectures title, “The World and the
Individual.” This theme will serve as a touchstone in the
following survey of Royce’s work in metaphysics and
epistemology, ethics and practical philosophy, religious philosophy,
and logic.
